evidence_collection.quote_text: I will not allow the mistakes of recent decades past to define the course of our future. For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land.

A new chapter of American greatness is now beginning. A new national pride is sweeping across our Nation. And a new surge of optimism is placing impossible dreams firmly within our grasp. What we are witnessing today is the renewal of the American spirit.

Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first. Because only then can we truly make America great again.
evidence_collection.context_type: Direct claim of popular will and direct action

evidence_collection.quote_text: To any in Congress who do not believe we should enforce our laws, I would ask you this one question: What would you say to the American family that loses their jobs, their income, or their loved one because America refused to uphold its laws and defend its borders?
evidence_collection.context_type: Framing of opposition as harmful and illegitimate

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have begun to drain the swamp of government corruption by imposing a 5-year ban on lobbying by executive branch officials and a lifetime ban on becoming lobbyists for a foreign government.
evidence_collection.context_type: Direct statement of systemic corruption and proposed remedy

evidence_collection.quote_text: I’m not a politician, I’m a real person.
We are one people, with one destiny. We all bleed the same blood. We all salute the same great American flag. And we all are made by the same God.
We’ve defended the borders of other nations, while leaving our own borders wide open for anyone to cross and for drugs to pour in at a now unprecedented rate.
evidence_collection.context_type: Statement on border policy and perceived external threats

evidence_collection.quote_text: For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities.
evidence_collection.context_type: Framing of economic decline and betrayal

evidence_collection.quote_text: No issue better illustrates the divide between America's working class and America's political class than illegal immigration. Wealthy politicians and donors push for open borders while living their lives behind walls and gates and guards.

my administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades. In just over 2 years since the election, we have launched an unprecedented economic boom, a boom that has rarely been seen before.
evidence_collection.context_type: crisis framing; problem-solution narrative; historical comparison

evidence_collection.quote_text: The agenda I will lay out this evening is not a Republican agenda or a Democrat agenda. It's the agenda of the American people. Many of us have campaigned on the same core promises: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers
evidence_collection.context_type: implicit popular will; bypass institutional labels

evidence_collection.quote_text: An economic miracle is taking place in the United States, and the only thing that can stop it are foolish wars, politics, or ridiculous, partisan investigations. If there is going to be peace and legislation, there cannot be war and investigation.
evidence_collection.context_type: delegitimization of opposition; partisan investigations as obstacles

evidence_collection.quote_text: I don't blame China for taking advantage of us; I blame our leaders and representatives for allowing this travesty to happen.
evidence_collection.context_type: blame attribution to political leadership; systemic failure

evidence_collection.quote_text: my administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades. ...For years, politicians promised them they would renegotiate for a better deal, but no one ever tried, until now.
evidence_collection.context_type: contrast with traditional politicians; claims of unique effectiveness

evidence_collection.quote_text: govern not as two parties, but as one Nation. ...We must choose whether we are defined by our differences or whether we dare to transcend them.
evidence_collection.context_type: call for national unity; transcendence of internal divisions

evidence_collection.quote_text: I have ordered another 3,750 troops to our southern border to prepare for this tremendous onslaught. ...Tonight we renew our resolve that America will never be a socialist country. ...We must keep America first in our hearts, we must keep freedom alive in our souls, and we must always keep faith in America's destiny that one Nation, under God, must be the hope and the promise and the light and the glory among all the nations of the world.
evidence_collection.context_type: external threat framing; national identity defense; America First ideology

evidence_collection.quote_text: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers... Meanwhile, working-class Americans are left to pay the price for mass illegal immigration: reduced jobs, lower wages... It's unacceptable that Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drugs... This is wrong, this is unfair, and together, we will stop it, and we'll stop it fast.
evidence_collection.context_type: economic grievance framing; blame on external actors/elites; promises of economic benefit for the people

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is my fifth such speech to Congress, and once again, I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do. I could find a cure to the most devastating disease, a disease that would wipe out entire nations, or announce the answers to the greatest economy in history or the stoppage of crime to the lowest levels ever recorded, and these people sitting right here will not clap, will not stand and certainly will not cheer for these astronomical achievements. They won’t do it no matter what, five, five times I’ve been up here. It’s very sad, and it just shouldn’t be this way.

America is back. Six weeks ago, I stood beneath the dome of this Capitol and proclaimed the dawn of the Golden Age of America. From that moment on, it has been nothing but swift and unrelenting action to usher in the greatest and most successful era in the history of our country.

The presidential election of November 5th was a mandate like has not been seen in many decades. We won all seven swing states, giving us an Electoral College victory of 312 votes. We won the popular vote by big numbers and won counties in our country 2,700 to 525 on a map that reads almost completely red for Republican.
I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do.
Because we are draining the swamp, it’s very simple, and the days of rule by unelected bureaucrats are over.
We have ended weaponized government, where, as an example, a sitting president is allowed to viciously prosecute his political opponent like me. How did that work out? Not too good, not too good.
My fellow citizens: America is back. Our spirit is back. Our pride is back. Our confidence is back. And the American Dream is surging bigger and better than ever before.

Within hours of taking the oath of office, I declared a national emergency on our southern border, and I deployed the U.S. military and Border Patrol to repel the invasion of our country, and what a job they’ve done. As a result, illegal border crossings last month were by far the lowest ever recorded, ever. They heard my words and they chose not to come.

As you know, we inherited from the last administration an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare. Their policies drove up energy prices, pushed up grocery costs, and drove the necessities of life out of reach for millions and millions of Americans, they’ve never had anything like it.

This is my fifth such speech to Congress, and once again, I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do. I could find a cure to the most devastating disease, a disease that would wipe out entire nations, or announce the answers to the greatest economy in history or the stoppage of crime to the lowest levels ever recorded, and these people sitting right here will not clap, will not stand and certainly will not cheer for these astronomical achievements. They won’t do it no matter what, five, five times I’ve been up here. It’s very sad, and it just shouldn’t be this way.

America is back. Six weeks ago, I stood beneath the dome of this Capitol and proclaimed the dawn of the Golden Age of America. From that moment on, it has been nothing but swift and unrelenting action to usher in the greatest and most successful era in the history of our country.

The presidential election of November 5th was a mandate like has not been seen in many decades. We won all seven swing states, giving us an Electoral College victory of 312 votes. We won the popular vote by big numbers and won counties in our country 2,700 to 525 on a map that reads almost completely red for Republican.
I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do.
Because we are draining the swamp, it’s very simple, and the days of rule by unelected bureaucrats are over.
We have ended weaponized government, where, as an example, a sitting president is allowed to viciously prosecute his political opponent like me. How did that work out? Not too good, not too good.
My fellow citizens: America is back. Our spirit is back. Our pride is back. Our confidence is back. And the American Dream is surging bigger and better than ever before.

Within hours of taking the oath of office, I declared a national emergency on our southern border, and I deployed the U.S. military and Border Patrol to repel the invasion of our country, and what a job they’ve done. As a result, illegal border crossings last month were by far the lowest ever recorded, ever. They heard my words and they chose not to come.

As you know, we inherited from the last administration an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare. Their policies drove up energy prices, pushed up grocery costs, and drove the necessities of life out of reach for millions and millions of Americans, they’ve never had anything like it.

For too long, a small group in our Nation's Capital has reaped the rewards of Government while the people have borne the cost. Washington flourished, but the people did not share in its wealth. Politicians prospered, but the jobs left, and the factories closed. The establishment protected itself, but not the citizens of our country. Their victories have not been your victories; their triumphs have not been your triumphs; and while they celebrated in our Nation's Capital, there was little to celebrate for struggling families all across our land.

This American carnage stops right here and stops right now. We are one Nation, and their pain is our pain, their dreams are our dreams, and their success will be our success. We share one heart, one home, and one glorious destiny.

Today's ceremony, however, has very special meaning. Because today we are not merely transferring power from one administration to another, or from one party to another, but we are transferring power from Washington, DC, and giving it back to you, the people. January 20, 2017, will be remembered as the day the people became the rulers of this Nation again.
We will no longer accept politicians who are all talk and no action, constantly complaining, but never doing anything about it. The time for empty talk is over. Now arrives the hour of action.
For too long, a small group in our Nation's Capital has reaped the rewards of Government while the people have borne the cost. The establishment protected itself, but not the citizens of our country.
We will no longer accept politicians who are all talk and no action, constantly complaining, but never doing anything about it.

Whether we are Black or Brown or White, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American flag. When America is united, America is totally unstoppable.

From this day forward, it’s going to be only America First. America First. Every decision on trade, on taxes, on immigration, on foreign affairs, will be made to benefit American workers and American families. We must protect our borders from the ravages of other countries making our products, stealing our companies, and destroying our jobs.

Washington flourished, but the people did not share in its wealth. Politicians prospered, but the jobs left, and the factories closed. The wealth of our middle class has been ripped from their homes and then redistributed all across the world. America will start winning again, winning like never before. We will bring back our jobs. We will bring back our wealth.

I will not allow the mistakes of recent decades past to define the course of our future. For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land.

A new chapter of American greatness is now beginning. A new national pride is sweeping across our Nation. And a new surge of optimism is placing impossible dreams firmly within our grasp. What we are witnessing today is the renewal of the American spirit.

Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first. Because only then can we truly make America great again.
evidence_collection.context_type: Direct claim of popular will and direct action

evidence_collection.quote_text: The corrupt political establishment has betrayed the American people and to address their concerns, their hopes, and their dreams.

After years and years of wage stagnation, we are finally seeing rising wages. Unemployment claims have hit a 45-year low. And something I’m very proud of: African American unemployment stands at the lowest rate ever recorded.
All of us, together, as one team, one people, and one American family can do anything. We all share the same home, the same heart, the same destiny, and the same great American flag.
evidence_collection.context_type: direct popular will as ultimate authority

evidence_collection.quote_text: Soon afterward, dozens of countries voted in the United Nations General Assembly against America’s sovereign right to make this decision... tonight I am asking Congress to pass legislation to help ensure American foreign-assistance dollars always serve American interests and only go to friends of America, not enemies of America.

America has also finally turned the page on decades of unfair trade deals that sacrificed our prosperity and shipped away our companies, our jobs, and our wealth. Our Nation has lost its wealth, but we’re getting it back so fast. The era of economic surrender is totally over.
evidence_collection.context_type: systemic failure attributed to past elite decisions

evidence_collection.quote_text: This Congress can be the one that finally makes it happen. Most importantly, these four pillars will produce legislation that fulfills my ironclad pledge to sign a bill that puts America first. So let's come together, set politics aside, and finally get the job done.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to bypass politics for direct action by 'real' representatives

evidence_collection.quote_text: All of us, together, as one team, one people, and one American family can do anything. We all share the same home, the same heart, the same destiny, and the same great American flag.
For decades, open borders have allowed drugs and gangs to pour into our most vulnerable communities... Most tragically, they have caused the loss of many innocent lives.
Our massive tax cuts provide tremendous relief for the middle class and small businesses. To lower tax rates for hard-working Americans, we nearly doubled the standard deduction for everyone.

No issue better illustrates the divide between America's working class and America's political class than illegal immigration. Wealthy politicians and donors push for open borders while living their lives behind walls and gates and guards.

my administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades. In just over 2 years since the election, we have launched an unprecedented economic boom, a boom that has rarely been seen before.

I could find a cure to the most devastating disease, a disease that would wipe out entire nations, or announce the answers to the greatest economy in history or the stoppage of crime to the lowest levels ever recorded, and these people sitting right here will not clap, will not stand and certainly will not cheer for these astronomical achievements. They won’t do it no matter what, five, five times I’ve been up here. It’s very sad, and it just shouldn’t be this way.

America is back. Six weeks ago, I stood beneath the dome of this Capitol and proclaimed the dawn of the Golden Age of America. From that moment on, it has been nothing but swift and unrelenting action to usher in the greatest and most successful era in the history of our country.

The presidential election of November 5th was a mandate like has not been seen in many decades. We won all seven swing states, giving us an Electoral College victory of 312 votes. We won the popular vote by big numbers and won counties in our country 2,700 to 525 on a map that reads almost completely red for Republican.
I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do.
Because we are draining the swamp, it’s very simple, and the days of rule by unelected bureaucrats are over.
We have ended weaponized government, where, as an example, a sitting president is allowed to viciously prosecute his political opponent like me. How did that work out? Not too good, not too good.
My fellow citizens: America is back. Our spirit is back. Our pride is back. Our confidence is back. And the American Dream is surging bigger and better than ever before.

Within hours of taking the oath of office, I declared a national emergency on our southern border, and I deployed the U.S. military and Border Patrol to repel the invasion of our country, and what a job they’ve done. As a result, illegal border crossings last month were by far the lowest ever recorded, ever. They heard my words and they chose not to come.

As you know, we inherited from the last administration an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare. Their policies drove up energy prices, pushed up grocery costs, and drove the necessities of life out of reach for millions and millions of Americans, they’ve never had anything like it.
The corrupt political establishment has betrayed the American people

For too long, we've watched our middle class shrink as we've exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We've financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land. We've defended the borders of other nations, while leaving our own borders wide open for anyone to cross and for drugs to pour in at a now unprecedented rate. And we've spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas, while our infrastructure at home has so badly crumbled. Then, in 2016, the Earth shifted beneath our feet. The rebellion started as a quiet protest, spoken by families of all colors and creeds, families who just wanted a fair shot for their children and a fair hearing for their concerns. But then the quiet voices became a loud chorus, as thousands of citizens now spoke out together, from cities small and large, all across our country. Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first. Because only then can we truly make America great again.
evidence_collection.context_type: detailed crisis description followed by a call for restoration

evidence_collection.quote_text: Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first.
evidence_collection.context_type: assertion of direct popular will as political mandate

evidence_collection.quote_text: To any in Congress who do not believe we should enforce our laws, I would ask you this one question: What would you say to the American family that loses their jobs, their income, or their loved one because America refused to uphold its laws and defend its borders?
evidence_collection.context_type: framing of opposition as detrimental to the nation and implying illegitimate

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have begun to drain the swamp of government corruption by imposing a 5-year ban on lobbying by executive branch officials and a lifetime ban on becoming lobbyists for a foreign government.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit mention of 'draining the swamp' and systemic corruption measures

evidence_collection.quote_text: I just met with officials and workers from a great American company, Harley-Davidson. In fact, they proudly displayed five of their magnificent motorcycles, made in the U.S.A., on the front lawn of the White House. And they wanted me to ride one, and I said, 'No, thank you.' At our meeting, I asked them, how are you doing, how is business? They said that it's good. I asked them further, how are you doing with other countries, mainly international sales? They told me—without even complaining, because they have been so mistreated for so long that they've become used to it—that it's very hard to do business with other countries because they tax our goods at such a high rate.
evidence_collection.context_type: depiction of direct engagement with 'ordinary' Americans' grievances, contrasting with implied previous political class inaction

evidence_collection.quote_text: While we may be a nation divided on policies, we are a country that stands united in condemning hate and evil in all of its very ugly forms. ... We are one people with one destiny. We all bleed the same blood. We all salute the same great American flag. And we all are made by the same God.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong assertion of national unity and shared identity

evidence_collection.quote_text: Our obligation is to serve, protect, and defend the citizens of the United States. We are also taking strong measures to protect our Nation from radical Islamic terrorism. ... We cannot allow a beachhead of terrorism to form inside America. We cannot allow our Nation to become a sanctuary for extremists.
evidence_collection.context_type: emphasis on national protection from external threats and exclusionary rhetoric

evidence_collection.quote_text: For too long, we've watched our middle class shrink as we've exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries.
evidence_collection.context_type: framing of economic decline as a result of external forces and betrayal

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is my fifth such speech to Congress, and once again, I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do. I could find a cure to the most devastating disease, a disease that would wipe out entire nations, or announce the answers to the greatest economy in history or the stoppage of crime to the lowest levels ever recorded, and these people sitting right here will not clap, will not stand and certainly will not cheer for these astronomical achievements. They won’t do it no matter what, five, five times I’ve been up here. It’s very sad, and it just shouldn’t be this way.

America is back. Six weeks ago, I stood beneath the dome of this Capitol and proclaimed the dawn of the Golden Age of America. From that moment on, it has been nothing but swift and unrelenting action to usher in the greatest and most successful era in the history of our country.

The presidential election of November 5th was a mandate like has not been seen in many decades. We won all seven swing states, giving us an Electoral College victory of 312 votes. We won the popular vote by big numbers and won counties in our country 2,700 to 525 on a map that reads almost completely red for Republican.
I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud, nothing I can do.
Because we are draining the swamp, it’s very simple, and the days of rule by unelected bureaucrats are over.
We have ended weaponized government, where, as an example, a sitting president is allowed to viciously prosecute his political opponent like me. How did that work out? Not too good, not too good.
My fellow citizens: America is back. Our spirit is back. Our pride is back. Our confidence is back. And the American Dream is surging bigger and better than ever before.

Within hours of taking the oath of office, I declared a national emergency on our southern border, and I deployed the U.S. military and Border Patrol to repel the invasion of our country, and what a job they’ve done. As a result, illegal border crossings last month were by far the lowest ever recorded, ever. They heard my words and they chose not to come.

As you know, we inherited from the last administration an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare. Their policies drove up energy prices, pushed up grocery costs, and drove the necessities of life out of reach for millions and millions of Americans, they’ve never had anything like it.
The corrupt political establishment has betrayed the American people

For too long, we've watched our middle class shrink as we've exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We've financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land. We've defended the borders of other nations, while leaving our own borders wide open for anyone to cross and for drugs to pour in at a now unprecedented rate. And we've spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas, while our infrastructure at home has so badly crumbled. Then, in 2016, the Earth shifted beneath our feet. The rebellion started as a quiet protest, spoken by families of all colors and creeds, families who just wanted a fair shot for their children and a fair hearing for their concerns. But then the quiet voices became a loud chorus, as thousands of citizens now spoke out together, from cities small and large, all across our country. Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first. Because only then can we truly make America great again.
evidence_collection.context_type: detailed crisis description followed by a call for restoration

evidence_collection.quote_text: Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first.
evidence_collection.context_type: assertion of direct popular will as political mandate

evidence_collection.quote_text: To any in Congress who do not believe we should enforce our laws, I would ask you this one question: What would you say to the American family that loses their jobs, their income, or their loved one because America refused to uphold its laws and defend its borders?
evidence_collection.context_type: framing of opposition as detrimental to the nation and implying illegitimate

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have begun to drain the swamp of government corruption by imposing a 5-year ban on lobbying by executive branch officials and a lifetime ban on becoming lobbyists for a foreign government.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit mention of 'draining the swamp' and systemic corruption measures

evidence_collection.quote_text: I just met with officials and workers from a great American company, Harley-Davidson. In fact, they proudly displayed five of their magnificent motorcycles, made in the U.S.A., on the front lawn of the White House. And they wanted me to ride one, and I said, 'No, thank you.' At our meeting, I asked them, how are you doing, how is business? They said that it's good. I asked them further, how are you doing with other countries, mainly international sales? They told me—without even complaining, because they have been so mistreated for so long that they've become used to it—that it's very hard to do business with other countries because they tax our goods at such a high rate.
evidence_collection.context_type: depiction of direct engagement with 'ordinary' Americans' grievances, contrasting with implied previous political class inaction

evidence_collection.quote_text: While we may be a nation divided on policies, we are a country that stands united in condemning hate and evil in all of its very ugly forms. ... We are one people with one destiny. We all bleed the same blood. We all salute the same great American flag. And we all are made by the same God.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong assertion of national unity and shared identity

evidence_collection.quote_text: Our obligation is to serve, protect, and defend the citizens of the United States. We are also taking strong measures to protect our Nation from radical Islamic terrorism. ... We cannot allow a beachhead of terrorism to form inside America. We cannot allow our Nation to become a sanctuary for extremists.
evidence_collection.context_type: emphasis on national protection from external threats and exclusionary rhetoric

evidence_collection.quote_text: For too long, we've watched our middle class shrink as we've exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries.
evidence_collection.context_type: framing of economic decline as a result of external forces and betrayal

evidence_collection.quote_text: The corrupt political establishment has betrayed the American people and to address their concerns, their hopes, and their dreams.

After years and years of wage stagnation, we are finally seeing rising wages. Unemployment claims have hit a 45-year low. And something I’m very proud of: African American unemployment stands at the lowest rate ever recorded.
All of us, together, as one team, one people, and one American family can do anything. We all share the same home, the same heart, the same destiny, and the same great American flag.
evidence_collection.context_type: direct popular will as ultimate authority

evidence_collection.quote_text: Soon afterward, dozens of countries voted in the United Nations General Assembly against America’s sovereign right to make this decision... tonight I am asking Congress to pass legislation to help ensure American foreign-assistance dollars always serve American interests and only go to friends of America, not enemies of America.

America has also finally turned the page on decades of unfair trade deals that sacrificed our prosperity and shipped away our companies, our jobs, and our wealth. Our Nation has lost its wealth, but we’re getting it back so fast. The era of economic surrender is totally over.
evidence_collection.context_type: systemic failure attributed to past elite decisions

evidence_collection.quote_text: This Congress can be the one that finally makes it happen. Most importantly, these four pillars will produce legislation that fulfills my ironclad pledge to sign a bill that puts America first. So let's come together, set politics aside, and finally get the job done.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to bypass politics for direct action by 'real' representatives

evidence_collection.quote_text: All of us, together, as one team, one people, and one American family can do anything. We all share the same home, the same heart, the same destiny, and the same great American flag.
For decades, open borders have allowed drugs and gangs to pour into our most vulnerable communities... Most tragically, they have caused the loss of many innocent lives.
Our massive tax cuts provide tremendous relief for the middle class and small businesses. To lower tax rates for hard-working Americans, we nearly doubled the standard deduction for everyone.

I will not allow the mistakes of recent decades past to define the course of our future. For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries. We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land.

A new chapter of American greatness is now beginning. A new national pride is sweeping across our Nation. And a new surge of optimism is placing impossible dreams firmly within our grasp. What we are witnessing today is the renewal of the American spirit.

Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first. Because only then can we truly make America great again.
evidence_collection.context_type: Direct claim of popular will and direct action

evidence_collection.quote_text: All of us, together, as one team, one people, and one American family can do anything. We all share the same home, the same heart, the same destiny, and the same great American flag.
For decades, open borders have allowed drugs and gangs to pour into our most vulnerable communities... Most tragically, they have caused the loss of many innocent lives.
Our massive tax cuts provide tremendous relief for the middle class and small businesses. To lower tax rates for hard-working Americans, we nearly doubled the standard deduction for everyone.

For too long, a small group in our Nation's Capital has reaped the rewards of Government while the people have borne the cost. Washington flourished, but the people did not share in its wealth. Politicians prospered, but the jobs left, and the factories closed. The establishment protected itself, but not the citizens of our country. Their victories have not been your victories; their triumphs have not been your triumphs; and while they celebrated in our Nation's Capital, there was little to celebrate for struggling families all across our land.

This American carnage stops right here and stops right now. We are one Nation, and their pain is our pain, their dreams are our dreams, and their success will be our success. We share one heart, one home, and one glorious destiny.

Today's ceremony, however, has very special meaning. Because today we are not merely transferring power from one administration to another, or from one party to another, but we are transferring power from Washington, DC, and giving it back to you, the people. January 20, 2017, will be remembered as the day the people became the rulers of this Nation again.
We will no longer accept politicians who are all talk and no action, constantly complaining, but never doing anything about it. The time for empty talk is over. Now arrives the hour of action.
For too long, a small group in our Nation's Capital has reaped the rewards of Government while the people have borne the cost. The establishment protected itself, but not the citizens of our country.
We will no longer accept politicians who are all talk and no action, constantly complaining, but never doing anything about it.

Whether we are Black or Brown or White, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American flag. When America is united, America is totally unstoppable.

From this day forward, it’s going to be only America First. America First. Every decision on trade, on taxes, on immigration, on foreign affairs, will be made to benefit American workers and American families. We must protect our borders from the ravages of other countries making our products, stealing our companies, and destroying our jobs.

Washington flourished, but the people did not share in its wealth. Politicians prospered, but the jobs left, and the factories closed. The wealth of our middle class has been ripped from their homes and then redistributed all across the world. America will start winning again, winning like never before. We will bring back our jobs. We will bring back our wealth.
The corrupt political establishment has betrayed the American people

Because only then can we truly make America great again.

evidence_collection.quote_text: No issue better illustrates the divide between America's working class and America's political class than illegal immigration. Wealthy politicians and donors push for open borders while living their lives behind walls and gates and guards.

my administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades. In just over 2 years since the election, we have launched an unprecedented economic boom, a boom that has rarely been seen before.
evidence_collection.context_type: crisis framing; problem-solution narrative; historical comparison

evidence_collection.quote_text: The agenda I will lay out this evening is not a Republican agenda or a Democrat agenda. It's the agenda of the American people. Many of us have campaigned on the same core promises: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers
evidence_collection.context_type: implicit popular will; bypass institutional labels

evidence_collection.quote_text: An economic miracle is taking place in the United States, and the only thing that can stop it are foolish wars, politics, or ridiculous, partisan investigations. If there is going to be peace and legislation, there cannot be war and investigation.
evidence_collection.context_type: delegitimization of opposition; partisan investigations as obstacles

evidence_collection.quote_text: I don't blame China for taking advantage of us; I blame our leaders and representatives for allowing this travesty to happen.
evidence_collection.context_type: blame attribution to political leadership; systemic failure

evidence_collection.quote_text: my administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades. ...For years, politicians promised them they would renegotiate for a better deal, but no one ever tried, until now.
evidence_collection.context_type: contrast with traditional politicians; claims of unique effectiveness

evidence_collection.quote_text: govern not as two parties, but as one Nation. ...We must choose whether we are defined by our differences or whether we dare to transcend them.
evidence_collection.context_type: call for national unity; transcendence of internal divisions

evidence_collection.quote_text: I have ordered another 3,750 troops to our southern border to prepare for this tremendous onslaught. ...Tonight we renew our resolve that America will never be a socialist country. ...We must keep America first in our hearts, we must keep freedom alive in our souls, and we must always keep faith in America's destiny that one Nation, under God, must be the hope and the promise and the light and the glory among all the nations of the world.
evidence_collection.context_type: external threat framing; national identity defense; America First ideology

evidence_collection.quote_text: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers... Meanwhile, working-class Americans are left to pay the price for mass illegal immigration: reduced jobs, lower wages... It's unacceptable that Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drugs... This is wrong, this is unfair, and together, we will stop it, and we'll stop it fast.
